entities.name: MICROSOFT CORPORATION
entities.description: Microsoft Corporation is a multinational technology company known for its software, hardware, and services. The financial statements of Microsoft Corporation and subsidiaries were audited for the years ending June 30, 2021, and 2020.

entities.name: PCAOB
entities.description: The Public Company Accounting Oversight Board is a nonprofit corporation established by Congress to oversee the audits of public companies in order to protect investors and the public interest by promoting informative, accurate, and independent audit reports.

entities.name: COMMITTEE OF SPONSORING ORGANIZATIONS OF THE TREADWAY COMMISSION
entities.description: A joint initiative of five private sector organizations, dedicated to providing thought leadership through the development of frameworks and guidance on enterprise risk management, internal control, and fraud deterrence.

entities.name: BOARD OF DIRECTORS OF MICROSOFT CORPORATION
entities.description: The Board of Directors of Microsoft Corporation is responsible for overseeing the company's management and ensuring the company operates in the best interests of its shareholders.

entities.name: STOCKHOLDERS OF MICROSOFT CORPORATION
entities.description: The stockholders of Microsoft Corporation are the owners of shares in the company and are entitled to vote on corporate matters and receive dividends.

relationships.relationship_description: The PCAOB oversees the audits of Microsoft Corporation's financial statements to ensure accuracy and independence.

relationships.target_entity: COMMITTEE OF SPONSORING ORGANIZATIONS OF THE TREADWAY COMMISSION
relationships.relationship_description: Microsoft Corporation's internal control over financial reporting is based on criteria established by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission.

relationships.source_entity: BOARD OF DIRECTORS OF MICROSOFT CORPORATION
relationships.relationship_description: The Board of Directors oversees the management of Microsoft Corporation.
The stockholders are the owners of shares in Microsoft Corporation and have voting rights on corporate matters.
